title: [Large-Scale] Comparative Analysis of Science Textbook Design: Case Studies of Egypt vs. China

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in designing secondary science curricula and foundational understanding of pedagogical theories
context.additional_context: In-service secondary science teachers analyzing and comparing textbook design approaches from other countries to explore improvements for domestic education

learning_goals: Learners can comparatively evaluate the structures of science textbooks from two countries using horizontal analysis methodology.
Learners can explain three dimensions—cognitive objectives, learning objectives, and visual material efficiency—to consider when designing science textbooks.
Learners can propose project-based improvement plans for national science textbooks based on cross-country differences.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
